source.author: Conn, B.J.
source.title: Iridaceae
source.in_title: Flora of Victoria. Vol. 2. Ferns and Allied Plants, Conifers and Monocotyledons

leads.lead_text: Perianth tube narrow basally, abruptly widened c. 1 cm from ovary
Perianth tube gradually widened from base
Basal leaf solitary, 0.2–0.4 cm wide, cross-shaped in section
Perianth tube less than 2 cm long
Perianth tube more than 2 cm long
Flowers funnel-shaped; leaves somewhat fleshy, midvein and margins prominent; coastal areas of East Gippsland
Flowers bilabiate; leaves herbaceous, with several prominent veins; plants of garden origin
Perianth lobes flat, central markings often dark-edged
Perianth lobes undulate at margins and apex, central markings without dark edge
Flowers funnel-shaped, white to cream-coloured; perianth tube more than 4 cm long; lobes subequal, apex acuminate, margins and apex strongly undulate
Flowers funnel-shpaed to bilabiate, white to pale pink; perianth tube less than 4 cm long; lobes unequal, the lower three distinctly smaller, apex acute, margins and apex usually only wealky undulate
